data.name: SiteSettingsLDAPAdminUserNotFound
data.value: Girilen LDAP ayarlarına veya LDAP dizinindeki hesabınızın bulunamaması nedeniyle LDAP'a bağlanılamıyor. Eğer site LDAP'a göre ayarlanmış ancak şimdi LDAP'a erişemiyorsanız sistemden çıktığınızda bir daha bağlanamayabilirsiniz. Lütfen LDAP sunucusunun erişilebilir olduğundan emin olunuz ve üyelik adınızın ve e-mailinizin LDAP kayıtları ile uyuştuğundan emin olunuz ve sonra tekrar deneyiniz.

data.name: AwaitingApprovalIntroduction
data.value: The following content has changes submitted and awaiting approval. To review the content changes, view at least one of the pages where the content has been published, and either click the green check button to approve, or the red minus button to reject the changes. If you choose to reject the changes, you will be given the option to add some comments. These comments will be visible to the author who posted the content changes for approval.

data.name: CustomMachineKeyInstructions
data.value: You should replace the machine key in the Web.config file in the root of this web site with a randomly generated one. You can copy the generated one from above. Note that if you have configured the site to use encrypted passwords, you should change back to clear text passwords, then change the machine key then change back to encrypted passwords because the machine key is used for encrypting passwords. Note also that when you change the machine key it will log out all users and they will need to login again.

data.name: FeaturePermissionInfo
data.value: Users in selected roles will see this feature in the list of available features when adding features to pages or using the content manager to create new feature instances. Note that the user would have to have edit permissions on a page in order to be able to add any features. Typically, you will want to set All Users or Authenticated Users here unless there are specific roles that you don't want to be able to create new instances of the feature. It has no effect on a users permission to edit existing feature instances, it only controls the creation of new instances of the feature.

data.name: PendingPagesIntroduction
data.value: The following pages are currently marked as 'Draft'. This means they are not published and therefore only visible to members of the draft edit roles or edit roles. Members of the edit roles can approve the draft content on pages and can change the page to a published page by unchecking the 'Is Draft' checkbox in page settings.

data.name: RecoverPasswordMetaDescriptionFormat
data.value: This is the password recovery utility page for members of {0} who have forgotten their password.

data.name: RedirectHelp
data.value: 301 redirects are for pages that have moved permanently. The old url will return a 301 status code and redirect to the new url. The primary purpose of doing this is search engine optimization and ensuring a good user experience. If someone bookmarked the old url or it appears in search engine results this will result in the new page being served. Generally you should not have to add redirects here manually. If you rename a page and it gets a new url, the system will automatically create a redirect from the old url to the new url. However, if you then set the page back to the original url, you will need to delete the redirect manually. If you manually add redirects you should be very careful not to create any circular redirects where 2 pages redirect to each other.

data.name: WebPartAdminMediumTrustMessage
data.value: Sorry, this site appears to be running in a Medium Trust security environment. Loading 3rd party dlls is not supported under Medium Trust. You can still use all of the built in Features as WebParts, but you cannot load WebParts directly from the assemblies in this environment. For more information see http://www.mojoportal.com/mediumtrust.aspx

data.name: RolesThatCanAssignSkinsToPages
data.value: Roles that can assign skins to pages.

data.name: SkinVersionGuidInfo
data.value: The Skin Version Guid is appended as a query string parameter in the url for the CSS handler. Since browsers cache CSS based on the URL, changing this parameter is a way to force all visitors of your site to reload the latest CSS for your skin. You should reset the Guid whenever you have completed changes to your CSS, otherwise some visitors may still be seeing the CSS that was previously cached by their web browser.

data.name: DefaultRootPageCreateChildPageRoles
data.value: Default root level page create child page roles

data.name: DefaultRootPageEditRoles
data.value: Default root level page edit roles

data.name: DefaultRootPageViewRoles
data.value: Default root level page view roles

data.name: ModuleSettingsRoleHelp
data.value: Administrators and Content Administrators can view or edit any content. Therefore Content Administrators role is not shown, and there is no need to ever check the Administrators role except for the special case where you would like to lock out Content Administrators so that only Administrators can view or edit the content. In that case you can check only the Administrators role and no other roles and Content Administrators will not be allowed.

data.name: PageSettingsRoleHelp
data.value: Administrators and Content Administrators can view or edit any content. Therefore Content Administrators role is not shown, and there is no need to ever check the Administrators role except for the special case where you would like to lock out Content Administrators so that only Administrators can view or edit the content. In that case you can check only the Administrators role and no other roles and Content Administrators will not be allowed. However to protect content instance(s) on the page you should set Administrators as the only role in the Feature Instance Settings as well, otherwise Content Administrators can still get to it from the Content Manager page.

data.name: UnsubscribeByEmail
data.value: You can unsubscribe by clicking the link in your email copy of this letter.
